deck.name: Gaming Vocabulary
deck.description: Essential English vocabulary for gamers — FPS, MOBA, RPG, streaming and online multiplayer.

cards.definition: Away From Keyboard — temporarily not playing or responding
cards.context: Don't go AFK during a ranked match.

cards.definition: aggressive play style, or the attention of enemies in a game
cards.context: The tank needs to hold aggro so the healer can stay safe.

cards.definition: a cheat program that automatically aims at opponents
cards.context: That player got banned for using an aimbot.

cards.definition: an early, incomplete version of a game released for testing
cards.context: The game is still in alpha, so expect lots of bugs.

cards.definition: Area of Effect — an ability that affects a zone rather than a single target
cards.context: Use your AOE spell to hit all the enemies grouped together.

cards.definition: the list of games you own but haven't played yet
cards.context: My Steam backlog has over 200 games.

cards.definition: to block a player or character from being selected or from playing
cards.context: He got a permanent ban for toxic behavior.

cards.definition: a near-complete version of a game released for wider testing
cards.context: We got early access to the beta last weekend.

cards.definition: a computer-controlled character in a game
cards.context: The lobby was full of bots instead of real players.

cards.definition: a positive effect that strengthens a character, or a game update that makes something stronger
cards.context: The developers buffed the shotgun in the latest patch.

cards.definition: a specific combination of skills, gear, or stats for a character
cards.context: I'm running a strength build for this playthrough.

cards.definition: to stay in one spot and wait for enemies to come to you
cards.context: Stop camping in the corner with a sniper rifle!

cards.definition: a player who leads the team to victory through strong performance
cards.context: She carried the whole team with 30 kills.

cards.definition: a player who games for fun without focusing on competition
cards.context: I'm just a casual player; I don't do ranked.

cards.definition: an easy or exploitative strategy that feels unfair
cards.context: That cheese strategy won't work against experienced players.

cards.definition: an organized group of players who play together regularly
cards.context: Our clan has been competing in tournaments for two years.

cards.definition: winning a round or fight in a critical, high-pressure moment
cards.context: He pulled off an incredible clutch in the final round.

cards.definition: cooperative mode where players work together instead of against each other
cards.context: This game is more fun in co-op with friends.

cards.definition: the waiting time before an ability can be used again
cards.context: My ultimate has a 90-second cooldown.

cards.definition: the process of creating items or gear from collected materials
cards.context: You need iron ore and wood for crafting a sword.

cards.definition: the aiming reticle in the center of the screen
cards.context: I changed my crosshair to a small green dot.

cards.definition: the ability for players on different platforms to play together
cards.context: This game supports crossplay between PC and console.

cards.definition: Downloadable Content — additional content released after the main game
cards.context: The new DLC adds three more maps and a story expansion.

cards.definition: Damage Per Second — a measure of how much damage a character deals over time
cards.context: The mage has the highest DPS on the team.

cards.definition: a rare item that appears when defeating an enemy, or a landing spot in battle royale
cards.context: I finally got the legendary drop after 50 runs.

cards.definition: a confined area filled with enemies and challenges, usually with a boss at the end
cards.context: We spent two hours clearing the dungeon.

cards.definition: a release model where players can buy and play a game before it's finished
cards.context: The game launched in early access last month.

cards.definition: a hidden secret or reference placed in a game by the developers
cards.context: There's a cool Easter egg if you visit the cave at midnight.

cards.definition: an in-game animation or gesture a character performs
cards.context: He did a dance emote after winning the match.

cards.definition: the content or activities available after completing the main story
cards.context: The endgame grind for gear keeps players coming back.

cards.definition: a bug or unintended mechanic used to gain an unfair advantage
cards.context: Players found an exploit to duplicate items.

cards.definition: to repeatedly do the same action to collect resources or experience
cards.context: I need to farm gold before I can buy the upgrade.

cards.definition: First-Person Shooter, or Frames Per Second depending on context
cards.context: The game runs at 120 FPS on my new graphics card.

cards.definition: a kill in a shooter game
cards.context: He got 25 frags in a single round.

cards.definition: to ambush or surprise-attack an enemy player, often with numerical advantage
cards.context: Three players ganked me while I was farming alone.

cards.definition: Good Game — said at the end of a match as a sign of sportsmanship
cards.context: GG, that was a really close match!

cards.definition: a bug or error in the game that causes unexpected behavior
cards.context: There's a glitch that lets you walk through walls.

cards.definition: a player who intentionally ruins the experience for others
cards.context: A griefer kept team-killing us the whole match.

cards.definition: repetitive gameplay to earn rewards or level up
cards.context: The grind to max level takes about 100 hours.

cards.definition: an organized group of players in an MMO or RPG
cards.context: Our guild cleared the raid on the first attempt.

cards.definition: hitting an enemy in the head for extra damage
cards.context: A headshot with the sniper is an instant elimination.

cards.definition: to restore a character's health points
cards.context: The support player needs to heal the tank.

cards.definition: the invisible area around a character that registers hits
cards.context: The hitbox on that character feels way too big.

cards.definition: Health Points — the amount of damage a character can take before being eliminated
cards.context: I'm down to 10 HP, I need a health potion.

cards.definition: Heads-Up Display — the on-screen interface showing health, ammo, minimap, etc.
cards.context: You can customize the HUD in the settings menu.

cards.definition: a game developed by a small studio without major publisher backing
cards.context: Some of the best games this year are indie titles.

cards.definition: Kill/Death ratio — the number of kills divided by deaths
cards.context: My KD this season is 1.8.

cards.definition: to keep distance from an enemy while attacking them
cards.context: Kite the boss around the arena to avoid his melee attacks.

cards.definition: delay between a player's action and the game's response, caused by network issues
cards.context: I died because of lag, my shots weren't registering.

cards.definition: a main path on a MOBA map where minions and players fight
cards.context: I'm going to the top lane this match.

cards.definition: a ranking system that shows the top players or teams
cards.context: She's in the top 100 on the global leaderboard.

cards.definition: to gain enough experience to increase your character's level
cards.context: I need 500 more XP to level up.

cards.definition: items, gear, or resources collected in a game
cards.context: The boss dropped some amazing loot.

cards.definition: a purchasable or earnable container with random in-game items
cards.context: I opened 10 loot boxes and got nothing good.

cards.definition: the character or class a player uses most often
cards.context: I main the healer in every multiplayer game.

cards.definition: the system that pairs players together for online matches
cards.context: The matchmaking put us against a team way above our skill level.

cards.definition: the most effective strategy, character, or loadout at a given time
cards.context: The current meta favors aggressive rush compositions.

cards.definition: Massively Multiplayer Online — a game with a large number of players in a shared world
cards.context: World of Warcraft is one of the most famous MMOs.

cards.definition: a non-player enemy in a game, especially in RPGs
cards.context: Clear the mobs before engaging the boss.

cards.definition: a user-created modification that changes or adds to a game
cards.context: I installed a mod that adds new weapons and quests.

cards.definition: a game update that makes a character, weapon, or ability weaker
cards.context: They nerfed the assault rifle; it does less damage now.

cards.definition: Non-Player Character — a character controlled by the game, not a human
cards.context: Talk to the NPC near the market to get the quest.

cards.definition: a new or inexperienced player
cards.context: Don't be mean to noobs, everyone starts somewhere.

cards.definition: Overpowered — too strong compared to everything else
cards.context: That new weapon is completely OP; it needs a nerf.

cards.definition: a game design where the player can explore freely without linear restrictions
cards.context: The open world map is huge with hundreds of side quests.

cards.definition: a group of players teamed up for a game session
cards.context: Invite me to your party so we can play together.

cards.definition: a game update that fixes bugs or changes features
cards.context: The new patch fixed the crashing issue on startup.

cards.definition: a game mechanic where death is permanent and progress is lost
cards.context: Permadeath makes every decision feel incredibly tense.

cards.definition: a measure of network latency in milliseconds, or a map marker to communicate with teammates
cards.context: My ping is 15ms, so the connection feels smooth.

cards.definition: Player versus Environment — gameplay against computer-controlled enemies
cards.context: I prefer PvE content like dungeons and raids.

cards.definition: Player versus Player — gameplay against other human players
cards.context: The PvP arena is where the real competition happens.

cards.definition: to leave a game abruptly out of frustration
cards.context: He rage quit after losing three rounds in a row.

cards.definition: a large-scale cooperative challenge requiring a group of players
cards.context: The raid requires six players and takes about three hours.

cards.definition: a competitive mode where wins and losses affect your skill rating
cards.context: I only play ranked when I'm warmed up.

cards.definition: to reset and reassign a character's skills or stats
cards.context: I need to re-spec my character for the new meta.

cards.definition: to come back to life at a designated point after being eliminated
cards.context: You respawn after a 10-second timer.

cards.definition: Random Number Generator — the randomness that determines loot drops, critical hits, etc.
cards.context: RNG was not on my side today; I got zero rare drops.

cards.definition: a genre with procedurally generated levels and permadeath
cards.context: Hades is one of the best roguelike games ever made.

cards.definition: the optimal order to use abilities, or moving between zones on a map
cards.context: Learn the ability rotation to maximize your damage output.

cards.definition: to move quickly toward an objective or enemy position
cards.context: Let's rush B site before they can set up defenses.

cards.definition: a game style that gives players freedom to create and experiment
cards.context: Minecraft is the most popular sandbox game in history.

cards.definition: stored game progress that can be loaded later
cards.context: I lost my save file and had to start over.

cards.definition: the magnifying sight attached to a weapon for long-range aiming
cards.context: I put a 4x scope on my sniper for better accuracy.

cards.definition: a timed period in a live-service game with new content and rewards
cards.context: Season 5 starts next week with a new battle pass.

cards.definition: a cosmetic item that changes the appearance of a character or weapon
cards.context: I bought a rare skin for my favorite character.

cards.definition: a skilled player using a low-ranked account to play against weaker opponents
cards.context: That guy is definitely smurfing; no way he's a beginner.

cards.definition: the location where a player or item appears in the game
cards.context: The enemies spawn on the other side of the map.

cards.definition: completing a game as fast as possible, often using advanced techniques
cards.context: The world record speedrun for this game is under 15 minutes.

cards.definition: a group of friends queuing together, or an effect that accumulates
cards.context: We ran a five-stack and won every match.

cards.definition: short for strategy — a planned approach to a game situation
cards.context: What's the strat for the second round?

cards.definition: to broadcast gameplay live to an audience
cards.context: I'm going to stream for a few hours tonight on Twitch.

cards.definition: a person who broadcasts their gameplay live for viewers
cards.context: My favorite streamer plays competitive shooters every day.

cards.definition: a character role focused on absorbing damage and protecting teammates
cards.context: We need a tank to take the hits for the team.

cards.definition: a large fight involving most or all members of both teams
cards.context: We won the teamfight and pushed to their base.

cards.definition: a state of frustration that negatively affects gameplay
cards.context: I'm on tilt after losing five games in a row.

cards.definition: rude, hostile, or negative behavior from a player
cards.context: The chat was so toxic that I had to mute everyone.

cards.definition: exchanging items with another player, or getting a kill right after dying
cards.context: We traded kills and both teams were down one player.

cards.definition: an introductory section of a game that teaches the basic controls and mechanics
cards.context: Don't skip the tutorial if it's your first time playing.

cards.definition: a player who puts maximum effort into winning, sometimes used negatively
cards.context: It's just a casual match; no need to be a tryhard.

cards.definition: short for ultimate — the most powerful ability a character has
cards.context: Save your ult for the next teamfight.

cards.definition: a cheat that allows players to see through walls
cards.context: That player is using wallhacks; he always knows where we are.

cards.definition: when an entire team is eliminated, or when progress is reset
cards.context: They wiped our whole squad in under ten seconds.

cards.definition: Experience Points — points earned that contribute to leveling up
cards.context: You get bonus XP for completing the daily challenges.
